I'm also not going to Denmark, same reason, but I'm OK about it and so should you. I mean, it's Denmark. A rainy little monarchy made up of 100 islands some of which are barely inhabited. I know because I read Wikipedia, the go to stores for any boring filler about Denmark. But really, canceling a meeting with Denmark is like blowing off lunch with that third cousin who wears a monocle and waxes his mustache. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } But let's be real. Whether it's Greenland, Omar or Sleepy Joe, all you are watching is just a show. Those people are just comic sidekicks. They're the Gomer Pyle's of modern politics. Trump's turned his presidency into his dream job -- a talk show on wheels. And he's done it without having to spring for the budget, plus he lives in his own green room. And wherever he goes, the media follows like groupies slapping the gear. And if the helicopter is nearby, Trump can offer an opinion which fuels the next episode, even posing a question about Denmark's ice cube become story fodder. It's genius. And then there is this tweet from Trump, and ex (ph) John classic. Effectively, this is not just a presidency, it's the "Truman Show" re-done as the Trump show, which is good because Trump is way funnier than Jim Carrey. The danger is following the media's lead and getting obsessed by this. To them, it's the game of Trump and they're binging on it, reacting to every new plot twist and that's just not healthy. Instead, sit back, enjoy the show. It's all on good fun until of course someone loses an eye-land.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.sentences: All right, the Biden gaffe machine is back and Elizabeth Warren bust a move on the campaign trail -- 2020 roundup, that's next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Time now for our 2020 roundup. First up, a new Biden blunder. Here he is mixing up the decades of two major events in American history.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN (D), PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Just like in my generation when I got out of school, that when Bobby Kennedy and Dr. King was assassinated in the '70s, late '70s --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, King and Kennedy were assassinated about two months apart in 1968, not in the '70s like Sleepy Joe claims. The gaffe and the really low energy, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, the thing is, it's sad. And actually, that makes me a little nervous. And the media has kind of screwed it up for Biden because now you can openly question his mental acuity. You can discuss age-related mental decline, feebleness, even dementia because they labeled out that stuff, that narrative regarding Trump for three years so it's no longer unseemly. In fact, you can talk about this out of concern. And I do think people on the -- dems must be a little bit worried right now. I would be. I feel bad. I don't think it's that funny either.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Well, are you worried, Juan?

utterances.sentences: I wanted to run.

utterances.sentences: Look, Biden -- I'm going to tell you, this is nothing new with Biden. I have seen it personally. I know Biden, And so it comes across as part of Biden-shtick, his folksy charm. utterances.sentences: And he's confused.

utterances.sentences: -- do you think --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.sentences: Because I think that what you have to understand is even as you would lecture me, you are missing the point with Trump in 2016. I think you're missing the point with Biden. Biden is up in the polls, Jesse. His polls are getting stronger even though these gaffes occur.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The gaffe's charming.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: They are charming but this is Biden's problem as he is running as the guy who is experienced, who's been in D.C., who's supposed to know what he's doing.

utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. So when gaffes become part of the media story, everything that you do when you're speaking -- if you say something that is off, it's going to be magnified and that is going to be the case for the front runner. I think it will really matter when some -- when one of the other Democrats says something about it if they do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And you notice they haven't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And so far, they have not. Also, remember when everybody went crazy when President Trump's doctor wrote that note that said he is 100 percent the most healthiest person in the world. Everybody made fun of him and the media was like how could you that. But Biden had his doctor come out and say he had brain surgery, he is absolutely fine. There's only one person that can be president -- same thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Two brain surgeries as a matter of fact.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: For an aneurysm and we're glad he was fine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: I hate to admit this fact, but I have uncles who voted for Trump. I said, that can't be true. They knew how much I loved Hillary. That can't be true. I have not spoken to them about it so I cannot tell you why. I'm still angry.

utterances.sentences: She will sell out anyone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: First, Frank, and now her poor uncles. You know what though, but I find -- I think this is good because everybody knows somebody who voted for Trump and people have to stop lumping people into big anonymous mob- like groups in red hats. And it's like your sister, your brother - -and it's the same thing. You have Democrats in your family, you have Republicans. We should reminds ourselves of that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, who cares?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who cares?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I do.

utterances.sentences: They can vote for whoever they want.

utterances.sentences: You're dead to me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That means no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know where I am from.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, we know you have.

utterances.speaker: WILLIMS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You have some Republicans in your family.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I do. And so we have conversations. I think you are right. I just think people should talk about it. The idea though is that somehow, somebody is so out of touch and I think that, you know, for me, I get stunned when I realize like its 30 - 35 percent of the country is Trump supporters. And I'm like, have you missed something? Are you not in touch with what is going on here?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I want to know what her uncles think of her and her positions and whether they can talk to her about her voting record because of who she voted for. I mean, I don't think like this idea that Democrats think if you disagree with someone politically that you would no longer should be friendly with them or family members with them. I mean, you should probably get out more --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think I should --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- learn some lessons about why people feel the way they do. Maybe you could actually win a few districts back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think I should book here Sinza (ph) uncle on Watters World.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a good idea. And debate your uncle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was like Obama's half-brother, remember. Remember that guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what, I've got it wrong. I mean it's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Which one's which.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Elizabeth Warren is on the right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: On the right is Elizabeth Warren. But I thought at first, it was the person on the left.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I did too.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No, I thought it was on the right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The other one is also not Native American.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Actually, maybe more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh! Greg. That was a good one. Speaking of cringeworthy. Here is the mayor of New York City. He is speaking at a union conference. But his voice sounds a little funny. Listen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think they distorted his voice accidentally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Katie Pavlich, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City and this is "The Five." The president sparring with reporters for over 30 minutes this afternoon. Trump criticizing Democrats over Israel, defending his immigration policies and clashing with the media over bias. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: They are so bad for Israel. They are so bad for Jewish people. You take a look at the horrible anti- Semitic statements that they've made. You know what, the Democrats have to own it. I think that if you vote for a Democrat you are very, very disloyal to Israel and to the Jewish people. We are building tremendous numbers of miles of wall right now in different locations. It all comes together like a beautiful puzzle. So President Obama had separation. I'm the one that brought them together. This new rule will do even more to bring them together. I am the chosen one. Somebody had to do it so, I am taking on China. The fake news of which many of you are members is trying to convince the public to have a recession. The "New York Times" now has totally lost credibility. They are trying the racist deal. When I am not here the "New York Times" goes out of business very quickly. This guy is the most biased reporter -- NBC -- NBC News has less credibility in my opinion with guys like you than CNN. You have more credibility than this guy. Go ahead. And that's not saying much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And on and on it went. No stone left unturned, Jesse, fascinating?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I am the chosen one. I will go first. You know, I feel bad for you, Dana. You want to know why?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because you do your show when Limbaugh comes on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So you miss a good hour of it, but I listen and I will tell you in case you missed it. We know Juan missed it. I don't know if you guys saw it but he made two great points about this press conference.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: You have a radio?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I love it!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You bring it. Rush Limbaugh's synopsis for us --

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think these are very important points about these things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You're watching Scott Adams. He is watching my friend Bob (ph). Katie is watching "The Daily Briefing."

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Every day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan is reading the comedy's (ph) manifesto.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's it. No wonder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, when he does this walk to Marine One, this is the way he kind of conducts the orchestra. He is saying no, shut up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Stop with the asinine questions and he kind of glides down the row and conducts --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then goes back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- the press like a maestro. And it's a brilliant performance. Obama I think took five questions in 45 minutes. Trump takes about two dozens in 20.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, it's really great to watch it. And the other thing that he does is, is that it removes the faces of the preening media reporters from the television.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- because they shoot them from behind so they don't get to stand up -- hi, I'm -- this is so and so from ABC News and really get their face on camera. And that shuts them down so they can't pose. That's something else he's done and it's a strategic move that he's done. On the AOC plus three thing, they are so way out of the mainstream of the Democratic Party on Israel. The boycott and divestment scheme, 90 percent of the Democrats in Congress are against it. They're a very small minority so all Trump is doing is creating a wedge between those two groups and making the rest of the Democrats circle the wagons around the squad at the expense of Israel. And stop with the, oh, don't say disloyal. Trump's called Hitler every day on T.V. -- you're upset about one word, disloyal? And the other point about it is this. The message wars right now are being won by the president because look at the topics we're discussing. We are discussing China, the economy, immigration and the squad. What are the Democrats saying? They can't even make a headline.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Electability.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They can't even make a headline except when they're on the debate stage and then they fall asleep. So, I just think the president is on offense. In a week, he's going away to Europe. He's going to dominate those headlines as well. And everything that they've tried has failed, the Russia hoax, Mueller, impeachment, the fake recession. I think the country is in pretty good shape that we are so entertained by these news conferences.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I was not entertained at all.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the idea that he would say that a Jewish person who doesn't vote for him is disloyal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He didn't say that, but.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I just think this is tragic. And it's not just me. I just want to make sure that the audience understands. They say, well, you know Juan, you can be very critical of the president. I think you should know that the Anti-Defamation League claim out and said, "This is clear undiluted anti-Semitism coming from the president of the United States at a time when there is a spike in hate crimes directed at Jewish people. He is suggesting that Jewish people who don't vote for him are disloyal." I find this so deeply troubling. You want to get involved in the way that he handles this and all -- to me, we don't have press briefings. We don't have press conferences. You talk about availability. He is shutting down people. No, I am moving on. No follow-up questions. And then he calls himself -- then he says, "I'm the chosen one." Now, I don't think you have to be a biblical scholar to figure out this guy is not Jesus Christ, OK.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He never said that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait? He's not? My god, you're taking this literally, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank god you're explaining this for us.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, because --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I thought he was Jesus.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- it is so -- you thought he was, OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I thought he was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I think the idea that-- Greg, the idea that he is using this kind of language. You can say, well, he's being funny -- I don't think it's funny for him to do this, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I find it --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, can I ask you a question? When Barack Obama said he'd take it as a personal insult to his legacy if black Americans did not vote for him --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- do you think that that's kind of creating a test of loyalty among an ethnic group?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, so what is the difference?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The difference here is this guy just said you are disloyal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, well what about my analogy which was so --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let's get Katie in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was a weak analogy. What do you -- I can't help it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Katie who knows a lot about condition (ph). You want to weigh on that part?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: The disloyalty point?

utterances.speaker: PPERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Look, I understand it's not just liberals and Jews upset about the term disloyal. However, I think when you look at the context of how President Trump has treated Israel versus the way that Ilhan Omar and Rashida Tlaib have treated Israel, the backing of what they're saying is very different. Now, he did not say you are disloyal if you don't vote for me. He said you are disloyal if you don't vote for Democrats. Now, you can imply that but don't say --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If you don't vote for Democrats?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right, but don't say that he said something --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think you meant Republicans.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- that he did not say. He said if you vote for Democrats you are disloyal. That's what he said. He did not say if you don't vote for me, you are disloyal. So on that point, maybe the wording could be different, but that's not the point. This president took the go on, gave it back to Israel. They've had it for decades. He moved the embassy into Jerusalem, something that Democrats and Republicans have voted for, for decades. He finally actually did it. Ilhan Omar and Rashida Tlaib, when we talked about this yesterday and on Monday, they are interested in destroying Israel by the BDS movement.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, stop! That's so wrong. And you know what --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is an interesting thing and I said --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It's true, Juan!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- let's get Reagan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- he shouldn't be making a judgment --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's get Reagan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Gerg.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- that they feel only about Israel. Jewish people are Americans first --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So what does it have to do --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can like two things. It's like I happen to like more than the United States. I am a huge fan of Iceland.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because it is green.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I thought it was Greenland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, we're buying Greenland. Look, Israel -- I mean, this is news to me that Israel is naming like a town after an anti-Semitic person.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like they're naming a town like this is -- when he says that he's might be the most beloved president from Israel, he kind of has evidence when they are naming a city or a town after him. Look, and to the point about accessibility, this guy has been more open and accessible and transparent to the media. I think that he earns the right to bash them mercilessly when he is out there because he -- look, Juan, when he was there, he actively courts the questions. He doesn't avoid them. He pursues them. He looks at somebody and he goes like this. He's like a boxer. He goes after each person. And it's also a consensual feedback loop. We just showed Trump. We didn't hear all the questions. But you have to listen to the questions which are designed to sustain a conflict and to drive a narrative. It's just like whispers from "Mean Girls." It's like, I heard you said they were anti-Semitic, is that true? Why did you say there was a recession? Is there a recession? They are all trying to push his buttons. His buttons do get pushed, but what I'm saying, it's mutually -- it's a mutual consensual feedback loop. It's enjoyable. We get all this bucket of news that we get to feast on for four hours until something else comes along.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It helps in the dog days of August.

utterances.speaker: GUTFLED
utterances.utterance: It certainly does. So why do you have to call it dog days?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because dog days are good, I think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are they?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Dog days, is it like lazy dogs? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. Why can't it be cat days?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know why it's called that. Nobody has cat days. Nobody wants a cat day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow~

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Except for my sister. She has four rescue cats. All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where is this going?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Up next, frosty foreign policy of President Trump feuding with Denmark over buying Greenland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here's a sentence I thought I would never say. President Trump postpones a trip to Denmark because the prime minister won't sell him Greenland. I'm also not going to Denmark, same reason, but I'm OK about it and so should you. I mean, it's Denmark. A rainy little monarchy made up of 100 islands some of which are barely inhabited. I know because I read Wikipedia, the go to stores for any boring filler about Denmark. But really, canceling a meeting with Denmark is like blowing off lunch with that third cousin who wears a monocle and waxes his mustache. But let's be real. Whether it's Greenland, Omar or Sleepy Joe, all you are watching is just a show. Those people are just comic sidekicks. They're the Gomer Pyle's of modern politics. Trump's turned his presidency into his dream job -- a talk show on wheels. And he's done it without having to spring for the budget, plus he lives in his own green room. And wherever he goes, the media follows like groupies slapping the gear. And if the helicopter is nearby, Trump can offer an opinion which fuels the next episode, even posing a question about Denmark's ice cube become story fodder. It's genius. And then there is this tweet from Trump, and ex (ph) John classic. Effectively, this is not just a presidency, it's the "Truman Show" re-done as the Trump show, which is good because Trump is way funnier than Jim Carrey. The danger is following the media's lead and getting obsessed by this. To them, it's the game of Trump and they're binging on it, reacting to every new plot twist and that's just not healthy. Instead, sit back, enjoy the show. It's all on good fun until of course someone loses an eye-land.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I see that little --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Very clever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It started with the island and were backwards.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I see what you did there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm ashamed of it, Dana. I think Denmark is playing hard to get. They want to track the highest bid. This is what you do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, play them like "Art of the Deal."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like "Art of the Deal." They are playing it. They read -- they clearly read the book.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's like they got it, "Art of the Deal."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I always wanted to go to Denmark. I've never been. I would like to visit. Remember, in all of these things, the prime minister, she has politics too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right? So, she has to deal with her press that is not the same as ours. Also, the president didn't really expect this thing to leak.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is apparently and they said they were talking. It's not like -- like he was making a serious bid. He's like, well, what could we do?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, what are the possibilities.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then it leaks and all of a sudden now we are in a fight with Denmark?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what, this is, Katie, this is kind of why I like Trump in the sense that he asks questions that I would ask like, does anybody own the moon?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like, he's a businessman. Everything is for sale.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Like we do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. Can I buy Easter Island? I bet I could.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes. Everything you tell Trump is a consideration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right? Like, he will talk about it openly and be like, oh yes, that is something that we can talk about and consider. And they talk about it and he changes his mind because he will talk to anyone about anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I am still on team manifest destiny in Greenland for lots of reasons. Everyone says that global warming is causing things to melt. More advantages for tourism, right? But let the Greenland people decide if they want to be part of America. Or Denmark, put it to a vote, they can decide. And then on a serious note, in 10 years the media is going to be saying what are we doing about the Chinese and Greenland because they want --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Russia.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- they want to mine in Greenland. They're already wanting to put a bunch of airports in Greenland. China is on a 100-yer plan. Trump is on his six-year plan that will extend to, you know, the history of the country. And that is something that we should be thinking about because China is already there and we're playing the short game and they are playing the long game.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, what are we going to do about Africa and Brazil? Oh, gee, what are we going to do about --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is the green new deal.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: That's what we're trying to do, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is the new green new deal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is the new green deal.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Greenland is close. It's only easier.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Only easier.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You know, manifest destiny Greenland is a little more optical (ph).

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was struck though that he -- the way he does diplomacy, he calls her nasty.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's called a lot of people nasty.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I know that. I know. All right. All right. Pathetic me. Anyway, I think, you know, this was an absurd idea. I thought this was a joke. But remember, he confirms the joke. If it was just a matter of --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: But it's not a joke.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- you know, private discussion --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- why did he have to come out and say, oh, I know. I really think this is an idea and here's the historical background. It was an absurd, preposterous idea.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And then he says, oh, why are you calling it an absurd, preposterous idea? The problem is with him and not with the people in Denmark, not with the people in Greenland. This guy he goes so far --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, you're missing the point.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: it's just that he --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What about the people in China.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- this is not --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hey Juan, you are having a mental break down. It's fun.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, you think it's the "Truman Show," that's what you said, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But it's not the "Truman Show."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, the "Truman Show" because Truman also --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The "Truman Show" would be like comedy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- that's the word.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: That's worth more now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This guy is supposed to be our president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, every single United States president would acquire Greenland if they had the chance. Two past U.S. presidents tried to acquire Greenland. That's not absurd. And he didn't make a rude and nasty statement when he floated this idea. It floated. He's open to it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It leaked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It leaked.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He didn't even float it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a conversation. And you know who is nasty? The Danish leader was nasty. All she had to say was, you know what, we love Greenland too and I appreciate the fact that the president of the United States also has loving feelings towards this part of the world. Maybe we can discuss it when we have this meeting, which I expect will go great and we can solidify --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- U.S. and Danish relationships. That's all she had to do, but she rudely dismissed it as absurd. So he cancelled it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Now, she has her own politics.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what, if I were here, I would use it to extract concessions from the United States of America. Oh, you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Say, you can have it if we don't have to do our NATO donation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly because they are under-budget on their NATO dues by a couple of, like billions of dollars. So, all she has to do is string Trump along --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, maybe -- you know what --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- maybe the rest of his term and court him --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, Greg -- Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- and get what she wants.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, you know what, there are people in Greenland. You know what she said? You can't buy people. So if Putin comes over and says hey, United States, I see your president is for sale --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm driving up the deficit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You're driving up the deficit --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You bought Louisiana.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- why don't we buy -- why don't we rush in and just buy New York.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's called the Louisiana push it, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Great question about Russia, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's absurd you Russians.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because Russia you say is a huge threat but the acquisition of Greenland would deter Russia --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I think Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So maybe you're not really serious about fighting the Russiansm are you?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Jesse, you should be either the next ambassador to Greenland or maybe the governor of Greenland.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're trying to get me out of here, aren't you?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying. There are very diplomatic solutions to the problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just think that we could consider all options and buy as many interesting things as we can --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- like Greenland --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like monopoly?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, like Saturn. Saturn, why not Saturn?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't care about space.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Too far.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't care? Too many rings?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Too far away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, the Biden gaffe machine is back and Elizabeth Warren bust a move on the campaign trail -- 2020 roundup, that's next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Time now for our 2020 roundup. First up, a new Biden blunder. Here he is mixing up the decades of two major events in American history.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN (D), PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Just like in my generation when I got out of school, that when Bobby Kennedy and Dr. King was assassinated in the '70s, late '70s --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, King and Kennedy were assassinated about two months apart in 1968, not in the '70s like Sleepy Joe claims. The gaffe and the really low energy, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, the thing is, it's sad. And actually, that makes me a little nervous. And the media has kind of screwed it up for Biden because now you can openly question his mental acuity. You can discuss age-related mental decline, feebleness, even dementia because they labeled out that stuff, that narrative regarding Trump for three years so it's no longer unseemly. In fact, you can talk about this out of concern. And I do think people on the -- dems must be a little bit worried right now. I would be. I feel bad. I don't think it's that funny either.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, are you worried, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Not in the least. I mean, you know, Greg was talking about Trump. I remember Trump just the other day was talking about the continental army was taking over airports and then he said that a shooting that took place Dayton, took place in Toledo. And I, you know, people just go right by it. But I think Republicans want to focus on the idea that Biden is old or Biden is fading --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wanted to run.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Look, Biden -- I'm going to tell you, this is nothing new with Biden. I have seen it personally. I know Biden, And so it comes across as part of Biden-shtick, his folksy charm. In fact, I think Obama in that "New York Times" article we've been discussing said this was part of the reason he liked Joe Biden, that he was just such an authentic guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And he's confused.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I will say this to you. You guys aren't Biden voters and I don't think you can objectively look at this --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How do you know that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- because -- because I'm just guessing. I'm just guessing that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't objectively analyze Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I can -- I can objectively do it,

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's it Juan. Katie --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. That's a different deal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- do you think --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But no, no, let me finish my point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because I think that what you have to understand is even as you would lecture me, you are missing the point with Trump in 2016. I think you're missing the point with Biden. Biden is up in the polls, Jesse. His polls are getting stronger even though these gaffes occur.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The gaffe's charming.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: They are charming but this is Biden's problem as he is running as the guy who is experienced, who's been in D.C., who's supposed to know what he's doing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And yet all of these things piling up show that he doesn't necessarily know what he's doing and that his experience isn't helping him when it comes to his major events. So, if he's going to make that argument that he is more experienced, the more competent than President Trump, he's going to have to get his facts straight on basic things that he says he, "remembers."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. So when gaffes become part of the media story, everything that you do when you're speaking -- if you say something that is off, it's going to be magnified and that is going to be the case for the front runner. I think it will really matter when some -- when one of the other Democrats says something about it if they do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And you notice they haven't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And so far, they have not. Also, remember when everybody went crazy when President Trump's doctor wrote that note that said he is 100 percent the most healthiest person in the world. Everybody made fun of him and the media was like how could you that. But Biden had his doctor come out and say he had brain surgery, he is absolutely fine. There's only one person that can be president -- same thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Two brain surgeries as a matter of fact.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: For an aneurysm and we're glad he was fine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Up next, Thanksgiving is going to be pretty awkward for Kirsten Gillibrand this year. Watch this.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KIRSTEN GILLIBRAND (D-NY), PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I hate to admit this fact, but I have uncles who voted for Trump. I said, that can't be true. They knew how much I loved Hillary. That can't be true. I have not spoken to them about it so I cannot tell you why. I'm still angry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, the junior senator from New York, Greg, she has to maybe make some amends with her family.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She will sell out anyone.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: First, Frank, and now her poor uncles. You know what though, but I find -- I think this is good because everybody knows somebody who voted for Trump and people have to stop lumping people into big anonymous mob- like groups in red hats. They are your mother. They are your father. I have a friend of mine who is very liberal and his like, almost his entire family voted for Trump. And it's like your sister, your brother - -and it's the same thing. You have Democrats in your family, you have Republicans. We should reminds ourselves of that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, who cares?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who cares?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They can vote for whoever they want.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're dead to me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you have any Democrats in your family?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That means no.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know where I am from.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, we know you have.

utterances.speaker: WILLIMS
utterances.utterance: I am like family to her. Yes, I'm a Democrat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You have some Republicans in your family.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I do. And so we have conversations. I think you are right. I just think people should talk about it. The idea though is that somehow, somebody is so out of touch and I think that, you know, for me, I get stunned when I realize like its 30 - 35 percent of the country is Trump supporters. And I'm like, have you missed something? Are you not in touch with what is going on here?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I want to know what her uncles think of her and her positions and whether they can talk to her about her voting record because of who she voted for. I mean, I don't think like this idea that Democrats think if you disagree with someone politically that you would no longer should be friendly with them or family members with them. I mean, you should probably get out more --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think I should --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- learn some lessons about why people feel the way they do. Maybe you could actually win a few districts back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think I should book here Sinza (ph) uncle on Watters World.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a good idea. And debate your uncle.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was like Obama's half-brother, remember. Remember that guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I love that guy. And finally, a two for one special, courtesy of Liz Warren. Here she is busting out her cringe worthy dance moves.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You know what this proves, we didn't know Elizabeth Warren was white already. There it is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh! My God. That was like Theresa May almost. Remember that. And also, this is something, I'm a little jealous of, she met her doppelganger. I mean I don't even know who's who there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, I've got it wrong. I mean it's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Which one's which.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Elizabeth Warren is on the right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: On the right is Elizabeth Warren. But I thought at first, it was the person on the left.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I did too.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: No, I thought it was on the right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The other one is also not Native American.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Actually, maybe more.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh! Greg. That was a good one. Speaking of cringeworthy. Here is the mayor of New York City. He is speaking at a union conference. But his voice sounds a little funny. Listen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh! My God.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think they distorted his voice accidentally.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's plane got canceled and he couldn't get there. So, they had to do it by Skype or somehow the audio got - and I looked at this in a commercial break during The Daily Briefing. I was laughing so hard. I sent into Reagan, our producer and I was like we've got to get this in.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. That was classic.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is hard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow. I like to see that whole debate like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I might vote for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. No, you won't.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I wouldn't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Marianne's your lady. The Feds are being roasted over a new thermostat recommendation. How high they say you should set it. Listen to this next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: People are now furious with the federal government for trying to control our thermostats. Yes. New guidelines say the coolest you should keep your home 78 degrees. When you're asleep, you have to jag it up, 82 degrees. And when you're not at home, it should be 85 degrees. Katie, you know what the experts say is during the daytime it should be like 65 to 72. But now you get energy star which is the EPA and the Department of Energy saying, 78 during the day, 82 when you're sleeping--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: That's what the communists say.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh! Is that it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I learned today that it is illegal in New York City to leave the store doors open while the air conditioning is running.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, I think the people who are experts on the thermostat are the people living in the house. You should decide how much you want to spend on electricity.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: If you want to spend more money on your electric bill, then you put the thermostat lower and higher depending on whether it's winter or summer and you deal with the bill. This evens itself out in the marketplace because people don't want to spend a lot of money on the air conditioner bill, so maybe they will put it up at 85 when they leave the house, but they shouldn't be told or forced to do that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK, so Jesse, Katie's points well taken. According to the stats, if you lower the temperature of the thermostat by one degree you will save 3 percent on your utility bill.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, if this was the Obama EPA recommending this, I would be thrown into a fit of rage. But since this is the Trump EPA, I'm open minded and thinking about maybe this is something we can consider to save some money. Are you calling me a hypocrite? Is that why you're laughing at me?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Just like the straws.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Listen, if you want to save a little money, fine. I can't even figure out how to change my thermostat. I have to call a guy to adjust it, because I can't figure it out. There is too many buttons, buttons confuse me. I wish it was voice activated so I can just say like 69 and set it that--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can get it that way.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Technology.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can voice activated thermostats.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. I'm going to write, Johnny.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He listens to everything you say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cancel that Johnny.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, in all honesty I have trouble with the thermostat just like you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And my problem is then it gets hot at night and I think I don't sleep very well in that--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Me neither.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, they don't. Well, I did not grow up with air conditioning because in Colorado - in Wyoming, you don't really typically have it. But now living in - having lived in D.C. and then New York, you definitely need it. Also. If you leak - if you're a dog owner. You can't leave your house at 85 or 90 degrees during the day and they have to be inside there you have to have some sort of - so I agree with Katie, just let me decide and I'll pay the bill. But what they should do is have more nuclear power so that there is carbon free energy that is consistent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Good point, Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That was Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was against--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh! Sorry.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That was Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I was against this, but I was thinking higher the temperature, fewer articles of clothing at night. Catch my drift? Am I creeping out with this voice? By the way, sleeping at what 80, that's like hey, the best way to sleep is if you have the flu, you'll be sweating and taut feverish.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Who are they to decide? How do they decide this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And also, get this, the person who dictates this behavior always seems excluded from it. Like it's like, it's not for them, it's for the plebes. And then when you call them on their hypocrisy, right, you say, you're not living by your own rules. They say, well I did enough by getting others to comply. So right, it's when de Blasio takes his motorcade to Brooklyn for the gym and you call him and he goes yes, but I've already gotten New Yorkers to give in to these stare - stupid rules, is that a word?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I bet that the White House does not adhere to these new rules.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was about to say, if you go into the EPA building in D.C. and open the door, it is an arctic blast to your face. They got that thing cranking so high.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How often have you been there?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Never.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: People want to enforce behavior. So, they themselves are exempt from it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right. Like Elton John.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Scott and crew really need to get his act together.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just kidding.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Love you, Scott.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But you know what, I think there is a worry about things like blackouts, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's why we need more--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We had a blackout here in Midtown--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And it bumps the weekend.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And actually, we could talk about Cuomo and de Blasio and their decision about the nuclear power plant here. We are going to have problems in New York, and it will be--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, so that's a communal argument, instead of just thinking about we don't want the government to tell us what to do. WATTERS: Communal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because they have to look--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Communally hot, it's a blackout, you know where that leads.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm going to keep talking this.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Fun times.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Fun times. Higher birth rates America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right, a new trend called adult recess. Nevada braces for storm Area 51 and new Dancing with the Stars cast revealed. And there is a very familiar face in the crew all up in the Fastest 7. That's next.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: All right, welcome back. It's time for the Fastest 7. First up, grownups are getting in on the back to school fun with a new trend called adult recess. That's right. People are signing up to play their favorite schoolyard games like dodgeball, hopscotch and kickball. And there is also tasty treats like chicken nuggets and grilled cheese sandwiches. So, Jesse, are you into adult recess?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. This is for nerds that weren't good at sports when they were actually of age to play these types of sports. If you're of age and you're an athlete, you go to the gym, you play real sports, or you know you go for swim. This is weird. And people have too much time on their hands. And then I saw that they have tether ball.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I love that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I love tether ball. Are you any good at tether ball?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I was great. The only thing I would want to play is tether ball.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Actually, I was really good at kickball too. But tether ball, I was good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It surprises me that you are good at tether ball.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I probably wouldn't be that good now because I'm so short compared to everyone else.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's what I was thinking.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But we should play sometime.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Don't play with daughters.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, Greg, people are paying money for these things, they're paying $20 for general admission. $150 for a nine person kickball team. And the proceeds actually go to the Ronald McDonald House. So that's a good thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'd be into this if they had the nap part. When you were in school, did you have a carpet sample and a towel. And then you had a little carton of crappy milk. That would have cost a nickel.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was the worst time of my life. So no, these are idiots. They're all idiots. I condemn them and condemn them with my heart and soul.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Juan, would you play kickball or tether ball?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I want Greg to give me Graham cracker.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And peanut butter and jelly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I like the Graham crackers with a little milk. In fact, Nino who is on our staff just bought me some Graham cracker. Thank you so much. But one thing Katie, do they get recess in the middle of the workday? PAVLICH: No, it's like an event, an event company is making money off of this. America, it's amazing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, it's not really recess.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The world is--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because like if you go out in in D.C. at the end of the day, everybody, every staff on capital for example has a little team and they're down on the mall.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right. After work.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They're playing kickball, or you know what I'm talking about, right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, what's the difference.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It's not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But it's funny is that adults are doing this and meanwhile schools are actually cutting recess for kids.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And kids need recess, because money and time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, playing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Recess is free.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: They say it's for nostalgia, but I'm good being an adult. Up next, remember how we told you about 2 million people signing up to storm Area 51. Well, it started out as a joke, but the locals are not happy about it. A rural county in Nevada already declaring a state of emergency before next month's event in anticipation of massive crowds and the guy behind the viral Facebook event is now also promoting a huge music festival called Alien stock in the area. So, is this fire festival 2.0, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know I don't know. I mean I would not - if an employee came to me and said they'd like time off for this. I would fire them. I would fire them immediately. I think they should wear riot gear and they should just go after these people.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: The locals should go after them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I don't really care. You know what this is another testament to this time. We live in great times then you've got to go and create these things. It's like a fun time to be alive that this is happening.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Made up culture.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jesse, this event was created by a Californian. The U.S. government has warned strongly against them storming the area, which should be enough of a warning.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's the same thing as adult recess.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is exactly what it is. Exempted Area 51.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What are they doing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, no one storming anything. Do you think these people have the energy to storm from their couch? WILLIAMS: But what are they doing? What are they storming?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: They are storming Area 51.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what I think--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. I thought this was about aliens and that they were trying to find out if there really was--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: That's what they're doing kind of.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right? They're all going to go look for the aliens.
